
      Here ye all, 
      Along the shores
      Sails are set, 
      To drag once more. 
      Though cracked and torn
      Our sails appeared 
      The hull was worn 
      but still we cheered. 
      We'll make it out, 
      and not alone 
      Oh god above 
      Please lead us home. 

      Voyage awaits you
      past sandy stones 
      That line the bank 
      With shells and bones 

      For once we'd lost 
      Those naive eyes, 
      The setbacks ceased 
      To our surprise.

      Of prickly pears, and 
      Dented spines. 
      A message on the viser. 
      A comrade laughs, The lady gasped
      And they were none the wiser
